#pneumonia:

#persistent cough:
Likely from resolving pneumonia. Concern for volume overload as 
below but she did not tolerate diuretics. She was started on

#Acute on chronic HFpEF:
Patient presented with elevated pro-BNP (prior ___), ___ edema 
and new O2 requirement. Received IV Lasix boluses while 
inpatient. Repeat TTE unchanged from prior (mild to moderate MR, 
mild to mod TR, normal EF). ___ negative for DVT. No e/o 
ischemia on EKG. She was given intermittent diuretics which led 
to acute kidney injury so held on discharge. She was not on 
diuretics pre-admission. If persistently volume overloaded, a 
rhythm control strategy may be warranted as the patient may not 
be able to tolerate atrial fibrillation. 

#Atrial fibrillation with Rates to 130s: 
Trigger most likely following nebulizers and possibly iso fluid 
overload. Prior admission at ___ ___ for afib with RVR 
and converted spontaneously and she was discharged on atenolol 
12.5m PO daily and apixaban 5mg PO BID. However, apixaban had 
been discontinued and she has not been on any anticoagulation 
for months.  During current admission, TSH normal. CHADS2 of 3, 
so started on apixaban 5mg PO BID. She had difficult to control 
heart rates with tachycardia then bradycardia. She was 
ultimately discharged on metoprolol XL 200mg daily and diltiazem 
ER 120mg PO. She was stable on this regimen for >48 hours.
